title: Is 'century,' as in '20th Century,' normally capitalized? - Quora

response.answer_text: Unless it is a title, it is not capitalized. “I was born in the twentieth century,” or “I was born in the 20th century.” Fox, the movie and media company’s movie production division was titled, “20th Century Fox” and the words were capitalized because it was a proper name. In a history book, the chapter titles would be capitalized, such as, “America in the Nineteenth Century, ” but when used in the first sentence it would not be capitalized, “The nineteenth century saw the expansion of territory across North America, as well as a great increase in population.”

When it's a title as in “20th Century Fox”, yes. Otherwise not usually although some older writers will do so when indicating a single specific century on the grounds that it then beomes a name. So you would write the “18th Century” (or C18) but the “18th and 19th centuries”.
